repnme.cdata!:
West Bank and Gaza - fourth development
            policy grant : summary of discussion

abstracts.cdata!:
Executive Directors approved a
            development policy grant to the Palestine Liberation
            Organization (for the benefit of the Palestinian Authority)
            in the amount of $40 million from the Trust Fund for Gaza
            and West Bank to support the Palestinian National
            Development Plan, on the payment terms and conditions set
            out in the President's memorandum. Executive Directors
            expressed support for the Palestinian reform program,
            particularly the focus on strengthening the fiscal position
            and public financial management, and looked forward to
            reviewing the Bank's upcoming Interim Strategy Note for
            West Bank and Gaza. To strengthen support for reforms,
            Directors encouraged greater consultation with the
            Palestinian public and civil society. They also welcomed and
            urged continued close collaboration with the International
            Monetary Fund (IMF) and other donors. Finally, the
            importance of addressing the critical challenge of
            unemployment and job creation was highlighted.

docna.cdata!:
West Bank and Gaza - fourth development
            policy grant : summary of discussion

display_title.display_title:
West Bank and Gaza - fourth
            development policy grant : summary of discussion

15908685.trustfund:
TF097915-Palestinian Reform and
            Development Plan Development Policy Grant III

repnme.cdata!:
West Bank and Gaza - Palestinian Reform and
            Development Plan Third Development Policy Grant Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Palestinian Reform and
            Development Plan Third Development Policy Grant Project for
            West Bank and Gaza were as follows: outcomes were moderately
            satisfactory; risk to development outcome was substantial;
            Bank performance was satisfactory and borrower performance
            was moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes:
            reforms are possible even in the most difficult political
            environment. Complex reforms are best done in stages. The
            reforms began with the creation of a functional accounting
            system, which in the next stage was extended beyond its
            initial function of recording transactions to its use as a
            control mechanism. Keep your eye on the broad objective. The
            risk of the multi-stage approach to complex reforms is that
            the broad objective may get lost while focusing on the
            technical steps of the initial stages. Anchor reforms in
            institutionalized processes. Multi-donor cooperation yields
            a bigger reform impact. Political will at the highest levels
            is needed to maintain reform momentum.

docna.cdata!:
West Bank and Gaza - Palestinian Reform and
            Development Plan Third Development Policy Grant Project

display_title.display_title:
West Bank and Gaza - Palestinian
            Reform and Development Plan Third Development Policy Grant Project

repnme.cdata!:
West Bank and Gaza - Palestinian Reform and
            Development Plan Third Development Policy Grant Program

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of Palestinian Reform and
            Development Plan (PRPD) Third Development Policy Grant
            Program for West Bank and Gaza is to help the Palestinian
            Authority (PA) continue to implement the PRDP which will
            specifically support efforts to strengthen the fiscal
            position and increase government transparency and
            accountability. The operation is designed to support PA
            actions in two policy areas: (1) strengthening the fiscal
            position. Wages and salaries are the largest expenditure in
            the PA budget and until recently were the fastest growing
            component of the budget. To maintain progress, the PA must
            keep a tight lid on new hiring. PA plans to introduce a new
            integrated human resources and payroll system, which will
            streamline and automate personnel actions. These actions
            combined with earlier reforms will help control the wage
            bill and are substantial steps towards achieving the budget
            projections of reducing the public sector wage bill to less
            than 23 percent by 2010 and less than 19 percent in 2012;
            and (2) improved public financial management and greater
            transparency are necessary to not only increase
            government's efficiency, but to attract donor support
            for untied budget support. The program begins with
            re-establishing basic controls and moves on to developing a
            system of internal and external audits.  In the next year
            the Ministry of Finance expects to include an annex to the
            2011 budget that provides detailed financial information for
            all major development expenditures.

docna.cdata!:
West Bank and Gaza - Palestinian Reform and
            Development Plan Third Development Policy Grant Program

display_title.display_title:
West Bank and Gaza - Palestinian
            Reform and Development Plan Third Development Policy Grant Program
